result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence
CONCURRENT with Counts 1 and 2, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence

Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in court, in custody.  Attorney Jill M Skwor in court for Alvin Maurice Cooley.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Motion hearing held. Court holds colloquy with the defendant regarding the waiver of attorney/client communication privileges. Court finds that the defendant is waiving his right to attorney client confidentially freely, voluntarily, and intelligently. Sworn: Douglas Rebholz - prior counsel. Court sets a briefing schedule. Defense brief is due by 12/22/22. State to file a response by 1/27/23. Any reply by defense is due 2/10/23. Court adjourns the matter for a decision in Branch 29.
Decision scheduled for March 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Per order dated April 2, 2021, Appeal No. 2020XX1227-CR (2015CM402, 2017CF2803, 2017CM392), IT IS ORDERED that successor counsel shall be appointed for Cooley within forty-five days from the date of this order.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED  that successor counsel shall provide this court with a copy of his or her appointment order within five days of the date of appointment.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Cooley, by successor counsel, shall file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal within sixty days of the date on which successor counsel is appointed.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the state Public Defender shall provide successor counsel with a copy of this order.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley not in court, in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for sentencing. Defense counsel informed the court that the defendant refuses to leave cell. Deputies Johnson and Takerian informed the court of options to perform the sentence. Parties provide an update on the record. Court elects to hold the sentence in the Milwaukee County Jail. 

Case recalled. Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in jail cell. Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz appears. Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by defense counsel and the state. Defendant does not wish to make statements as to sentencing. 

*Defendant bangs on door cell, shouts, and uses profane language during sentencing*

AS TO COUNT 1 : The court sentenced the defendant to 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 DAYS time served.  

AS TO COUNT 2 : The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence.  

AS TO COUNT 3 : The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT with COUNT 1 AND 2 consecutive to any other sentence.  

Pay all MANDATORY surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during extended supervision in case# 17CF2803, any cash bail to apply. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to tax intercept and any applicable collection procedures. 
Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Provide DNA Sample.
Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.


Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley not in court, in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Sentencing hearing.  Deputy Matthew Takerian informed the court that the defendant refuses to come to court. Court ordered matter adjourned to allow defense counsel to speak with client. State informed the court that the proceedings can be heard without the defendant present. Case adjourned, branch 5.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Jury Trial exhibits from 11-28-2018 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 735.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  At the hour of 9:29 a.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts which were then read.  

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Alvin Maurice Cooley GUILTY of Misdemeanor Battery, as charged in count 1 from the incident on December 18, 2014."  

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Alvin Maurice Cooley GUILTY of Criminal Damage to Property, as charged in count 2 from the incident on December 18, 2014."  

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Alvin Maurice Cooley GUILTY of Disorderly Conduct, as charged in count 3 from the incident on December 18, 2014."  

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of 9:39 a.m. jury dismissed for the day.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  

Filed,

Jury Instructions;
Verdicts.

Case adjourned for Sentencing hearing on, Branch 05.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2018 at 01:05 pm.

Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

Jury in the box at 1:49 p.m.  Trial continued. State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 1:51 p.m.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. Court held colliquy with the defendant as to his right to testify or not to testify. Court found defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to testify. Jury in the box at 1:58 p.m. Defense rests. Jury out of the box at 1:59 p.m. Jury in the box at 2:35 p.m. State and defense rest.  Testimony closed. Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:02 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies L. Johnson and M. Takerian who were duly sworn for that purpose. In court discussion amongst the parties as to verdicts, jury instructions and exhibits placed on the record in open court. Court ruled with no objections from the parties that exhibit #'s 3 through 10 are sent with the jury.

Jury in the box at 10:44 a.m. Trial continued.  Sworn for the state: Melaina P. Exhibit #11 published to the witness by the state. Exhibit #s 3 through 10 published to the jury by the state. Exhibit #11 offered, received and admitted by the state. Defense counsel has no objection. Sworn for the state:  Dakota W. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Detective Michael Fidel. Exhibit #13 offered, received and admitted from the state. Defense counsel has no objection. Exhibit #14 offered by the state. Defense counsel objects. Exhibit #14 received and admitted by the state. Defense counsel withdraws objection. Exhibit #15 offered, received and admitted from the state. Defense counsel has no objection. Sworn for the state: City of West Allis Police Officer's Matthew Jacobsen, Ryan Stuettgen and Bret Vanden Boogard. Jury excused for lunch at 12:00 p.m. Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 05 on November 27, 2018 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. In chambers discussions as to defendant's jury clothes placed on the record. Sidebar conversation by the deputy in charge of the jury placed on the record. Further in court discussion placed on the record by the Deputy as to safety measures related to the defendant. Court ruled that defendant is REMOVED from the jury trial proceedings with possible return later.  Jury trial scheduled for November 27, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Trial proceeded. Sworn for the state: Coretta Robinson, Lead Dispatcher for MPD Telecommunications. Exhibit #2 offered, received and admitted from the state. Defense counsel has no objection. Exhibit #1 offered, received and admitted from the state. Defense counsel has no objection. Sworn for the state: Melaina P. Exhibit #'s 3, 4, 5, 6 & 7 offered, received and admitted from the state. Defense counsel has no objection. Jury out of the box at 4:16 p.m. Court instructed the defendant to remain silent unless a question is asked to avoid future verbal outbursts. Parties placed in court discussion on the record in open court. Jury in the box at 4:23 p.m. Still sworn under oath for the state: Melaina P. Exhibit #'s 8, 9 & 10 offered, received and admitted from the state. Defense counsel has no objection. Due to the lateness of the hour, Jury excused for the evening at 4:54 p.m. Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 05 on November 27, 2018 at 9:00 a.m. Sidebar conversation placed on the record.

Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Jury panel in court at 1:54 p.m. Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 1:56 p.m. Court instructed jury. 

Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Jury out of the box at 2:55 p.m. for afternoon break. Court placed sidebar conversation as to STRIKES on the record in open court. Jury in the box at 3:14 p.m. Court instructed jury continues. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Opening statements by state and defense.

Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for jury trial.   Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is DENIED by the court. For reasons stated on the record by Jury Management, Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 05.  Jury trial scheduled for November 26, 2018 at 01:25 pm.

Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Alvin Maurice Cooley in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for Jury trial. For reasons furhter stated on the record, the Court GRANTS State motion to admit 911 call. Defense counsel objects. For further reasons stated on the record as to jury trial posture. CASE PASSED AGAIN.  Jury trial scheduled for November 26, 2018 at 11:15 am.

For reasons stated on the record as to jury trial juncture, CASE PASSED.  Jury trial scheduled for November 26, 2018 at 11:00 am.
